snippet: More than 13 years after the police shooting of Amadou Diallo, Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly has agreed to restore a service weapon to Kenneth Boss, one of the four officers involved.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly agrees to restore a service weapon to Kenneth Boss, one of four police officers involved in the fatal shooting of Amadou Diallo in Brooklyn in 1999; victim's mother Kadiatou Diallo, who has in many ways become the public face of tragic fatal police shootings, is questioning Kelly's decision.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: More than 13 years after the police shooting of Amadou Diallo, Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly has agreed to restore a service weapon to Kenneth Boss, one of the four officers involved.

headline.seo: Police Officer Who Shot at Amadou Diallo to Get Gun Back
headline.main: Diallo’s Mother Asks Why Officer Who Shot at Her Son Will Get Gun Back
headline.print_headline: Diallo’s Mother Asks Why City Officer Who Shot at Her Son Will Get Gun Back
